incentives.description: Specially curated lineup of speakers and entertainment during the ceremony
Tickets for guests (guest ticket amounts may differ for each graduation)
Commemorative program with your picture and 75 word acknowledgment

questions.question: What do I need to submit to participate in the Graduation Celebration?
answer: Submit your 75-word personal narrative to be on your booklet (Optional)
Schedule your photo to be taken (Optional. Otherwise, photo will be replaced with a default image)

questions.question: How will my picture be taken for the booklet?
questions.answer: At the end of the Cultural Graduation Application, there will be an option to book an appointment to take your picture. Cap and gown may be provided for picture-taking purposes

questions.question: What should I wear?
answer: A semi-formal attire is preferred for picture taking and the graduation celebration. We encourage you to dress in your culture's traditional wear! Cap and gown may be provided for picture-taking purposes

questions.question: How will I receive my sash?
questions.answer: You will receive your sash the day of your respective cultural graduation inside the venue

questions.question: How many guest tickets do I get?
answer: ALL Graduations are open seating (not reserved). First come, first served
APIDA Grad # of Guest Tickets: TBD
Black Grad # of Guest Tickets: TBD
Native Grad # of Guest Tickets: TBD
Nuestra Grad # of Guest Tickets: TBD
Pride Grad # of Guest Tickets: TBD

questions.question: I have more questions about applying. Whom do I contact?
questions.answer: Please get in touch with the respective center coordinator or the Cross Cultural Centers (CCC) located on the 2nd floor of the University-Student Union. You may also email the CCC at ccc@calstatela.edu or call 323-343-5001
